III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title & (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Section policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
Description intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth went AWOL on 9/22/24. Youth did not want to return to the
facility because staff have told the youth to kill himself.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant responded to an email on 10/4/24 and reported
she did not have any additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/24/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported on
9/22/24, he got into a verbal altercation with Youth B and Youth B
told Youth A to kill himself. Youth A reported Staff 1 intervened in
the altercation and told them to stop. Youth A reported no staff
have ever told him to kill himself.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/24/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported on
9/22/24, he got into a verbal altercation with Youth A and Staff 1
stepped in between them and told them to “chill out”. Youth B
reported he couldn’t remember if he told Youth A to kill himself,
but he knows no staff said that to Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
9/24/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported Youth A has never complained or reported any staff have
told him to kill himself or said anything inappropriate to him.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 10/1/24 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported on 9/22/24, Youth A
started a verbal argument with Youth B and then tried to turn it
into a physical altercation. Staff 1 reported when he saw the
potential for the altercation to turn physical, he stepped in between
Youth A and Youth B to stop it from happening. Staff 1 reported
Youth A threatened to hurt Youth B, so Youth B responded by
saying “why don’t you kill yourself” to Youth A.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Bethany Christian Services Emergency Restraint Policy
and Procedures states the use of threats,
physical/emotional harm, and verbal abuse are strictly
prohibited.
2

Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per interviews conducted it
was determined Youth B, not a staff, told Youth A to kill himself.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
